perturbation.original_text: (a) "Product and Services Category " means flash data storage and/or video surveillance products.
perturbation.explanation: By omitting "flash data storage and/or video surveillance", the definition of Product and Services Category becomes ambiguous. This creates uncertainty in determining exclusivity and enforcement of sponsorship rights related to specific product types.

perturbation.original_text: In exchange for the Sponsorship Rights to be provided to Sponsor during each Contract Year of this Agreement, Sponsor shall pay an annual fee (the "Sponsorship Fee") during each Contract Year of the Term. The Sponsorship Fee shall be fourÂ­million U.S. Dollars (USD $4,000,000.00) during each Contract Year.
perturbation.changed_text: In exchange for the Sponsorship Rights to be provided to Sponsor during each Contract Year of this Agreement, Sponsor shall pay an annual fee (the "Sponsorship Fee") during each Contract Year of the Term.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the specific amount for the Sponsorship Fee, the contract lacks a crucial financial term. This creates a contradiction because the contract still refers to the 'Sponsorship Fee' in later sections, yet the agreed-upon amount is missing, leading to uncertainty and unenforceability.

perturbation.original_text:
Disputes Subject to Arbitration. Any dispute arising under or relating to this Agreement shall be resolved exclusively by arbitration under the Commercial Arbitration Rules of the American Arbitration Association, with the venue of any such arbitration proceeding to be in Santa Clara, California or such other location as maybe agreed by the Parties.

(b) Arbitrator. The arbitrator for any dispute shall be selected according to the Commercial Arbitration Rules of the American Arbitration Association.

(c) Arbitration Award. The award rendered by the arbitrator shall be final, shall identify a winning Party, and judgment may be entered upon the award in accordance with applicable law in any court having jurisdiction thereof
perturbation.changed_text:
Disputes Subject to Arbitration. Any dispute arising under or relating to this Agreement shall be resolved by arbitration.

(b) Arbitrator.

(c) Arbitration Award.
perturbation.explanation: By omitting, the full arbitration, details, the venue, the arbitrator selection process, and the finality of the award, the mechanism for dispute resolution becomes unclear. This creates a contradiction because the contract states that all disputes are resolved by arbitration without providing the details on how that process would work, leading to potential legal challenges and difficulties in enforcing the arbitration clause.
